Statement.CallString: CREATE USER u1 PASSWORD PW1 RESOURCE
CREATE TABLE tab1 (i1 int, char1 char(20))
GRANT SELUPD (i1) ON tab1 TO PUBLIC

Test.Comment: Try GRANT EXECUTE ON WITH GRANT OPTION and GRANT EXECUTE ON without ownership

Statement.CallString: CREATE USER u1 PASSWORD PW1 RESOURCE
GRANT EXECUTE ON proc1 TO u2
GRANT EXECUTE ON proc1 TO u2
GRANT EXECUTE ON proc1 TO u2 WITH GRANT OPTION
GRANT EXECUTE ON u1.proc1 TO u3
CREATE USER u1 PASSWORD PW1 RESOURCE
CREATE TABLE tab1 (i1 int, char1 char(20))
GRANT ALL (i1) ON tab1 TO PUBLIC

Test.Comment: Grant EXECUTE ON of a DBPROC from user u1 (resource) to PUBLIC.

Statement.CallString: CREATE USER u1 PASSWORD PW1 RESOURCE
GRANT EXECUTE ON proc1 TO PUBLIC

Test.Comment: Grant EXECUTE ON of a DBFUNCTION from user u1 (resource) to user u2 and u3 (standard). u2 was create before and u3 after the creation of the DBFUNCTION

Statement.CallString: CREATE USER u1 PASSWORD PW1 RESOURCE
CREATE TABLE tab1 (i INT PRIMARY KEY, v INT)
GRANT EXECUTE ON func1 TO u2
GRANT EXECUTE ON func1 TO u3
CREATE USER u1 PASSWORD PW1 RESOURCE
CREATE TABLE tab1 (i1 int, char1 char(20))
GRANT SELUPD (i1) ON tab1 TO PUBLIC

Test.Comment: Grant EXECUTE ON of a DBFUNCTION from user u1 (resource) to PUBLIC.

Statement.CallString: CREATE USER u1 PASSWORD PW1 RESOURCE
CREATE TABLE tab1 (i INT PRIMARY KEY, v INT)
GRANT EXECUTE ON func1 TO PUBLIC

Test.Comment: Grant EXECUTE ON of a DBPROC from user u1 (resource) to usergroup g2 and g3 (standard). g1 was create before and g2 after the creation of the DBPROC

Statement.CallString: CREATE USER u1 PASSWORD PW1 RESOURCE
CREATE USER u2 PASSWORD PW2 USERGROUP g1
GRANT EXECUTE ON proc1 TO g1
CREATE USER u3 PASSWORD PW3 USERGROUP g1
CREATE USER u4 PASSWORD pw4 USERGROUP g2
GRANT EXECUTE ON proc1 TO g2
CREATE USER u5 PASSWORD PW5 USERGROUP g2
CREATE USER u1 PASSWORD PW1 RESOURCE
CREATE TABLE tab1 (i1 int, char1 char(20))
GRANT SELUPD ON tab1 TO PUBLIC

Test.Comment: Grant EXECUTE ON of a DBPROC from user u1 (resource) to user u2 and u3 (standard). u2 was create before and u3 after the creation of the DBPROC
